questions.question: The PSR requires that where an officer is seconded or posted, all non-salary allowances shall be paid by:
questions.explanation: All non-salary allowances shall be paid by receiving MDAs (PSR 020504) [93], [94].

questions.question: The PSR definition of an **Internship** (PSR 020415) relates to structured experience that helps to enhance:
options: Academic, career, professional and personal development.
questions.explanation: Internship helps to enhance academic, career, professional and personal development, and facilitates acquisition of practical skills [39], [40].

questions.question: Which PSR rule ensures that an appeal/petition is not entertained if it is illegible or meaningless?
questions.explanation: An appeal/petition will not be entertained if it is illegible or meaningless (PSR 110208(iii)) [69], [70].

questions.question: The PSR requires Ministries to notify the FCSC when officers revert from acting appointment by completion of Form No. Gen. 15A which shall be forwarded not less than:
options: Two weeks before cessation of the acting appointment.
questions.explanation: The notification of cessation of acting appointment must be forwarded not less than two weeks before cessation (PSR 020707) [87], [88].

questions.question: Which PSR rule stipulates that the emoluments and incremental date of an officer on transfer is governed by Rule 040103?
questions.explanation: Rule 020505 confirms that the emoluments and incremental date of an Officer on transfer are governed by Rule 040103 [93], [94].

questions.question: The PSR requires that where the Head of a Department is not available for a period spanning one month (due to approved assignment or leave), the most senior officer is mandated to oversee the Office of the Head of the Department. This is covered by:
questions.explanation: Where the Head of a Department/Division/Unit/Branch is not available for a period spanning one month... the most senior Officer in the Department or Organization shall be mandated to oversee the Office of the Head of the Department (PSR 020708(b)) [87], [88].

questions.question: The PSR states that accommodation shall not be provided to any Part-Time Member of a Parastatal Board on a permanent basis, nor shall they be allowed to retain an official vehicle for use on a permanent basis (PSR 170202).
options: Only permanent staff may retain official vehicles.
Accommodation must be provided to all part-time members.
No Part-Time Member of the Board shall be allowed to retain official vehicle for use on a permanent basis.
The Minister may grant exception for vehicle retention.
questions.explanation: PSR 170202 strictly limits privileges for Part-Time Board members, prohibiting permanent accommodation or vehicle retention [43], [44].

questions.question: The PSR generally states that all previous editions of the PSR are:
options: Fully valid for ongoing disciplinary cases.
Entirely repealed and replaced, with savings for ongoing cases.
Used to interpret ambiguities in new rules.
questions.explanation: The PSR 2021 repeals all previous editions but contains savings provisions for cases already in progress [106].

questions.question: The principle of **Meritocracy** in the civil service requires that appointments into all grades in Parastatals must be based on:
options: Need-based, subject to merit, credibility, and equal employment opportunity.
questions.explanation: Appointments into all grades in Parastatals shall be need-based, ensuring merit, credibility and equal employment opportunity (PSR 170302) [43], [44].

subcategories.name: Innovation and Technology
subcategories.description: Innovation, technology adoption, and modernization in civil service

questions.question: Which chapter of the Civil Service Handbook encourages the use of **Information Technology (IT)** in modernizing civil service operations?
questions.explanation: Chapter 8 encourages the use of IT in modernizing civil service operations and enhancing efficiency [107].

questions.question: The acronym **IPPIS** stands for:
options: Integrated Personnel and Payroll Information System.
Internal Planning and Policy Implementation System.
Information Processing and Public Integrity System.
questions.explanation: IPPIS stands for Integrated Personnel and Payroll Information System [108], [109].

questions.question: The primary objective of implementing **IPPIS** across the civil service is to:
options: Automate payroll, eliminate ghost workers, and improve transparency.
questions.explanation: IPPIS automates payroll, eliminates ghost workers, and improves transparency in personnel emoluments [110], [111], [112].

questions.question: The acronym **GIFMIS** stands for:
options: General Information on Funds Monitoring Integrated Service.
Government Integrated Financial Management Information System.
questions.explanation: GIFMIS stands for Government Integrated Financial Management Information System [109], [113].

questions.question: Which PSR Chapter introduced the use of **virtual meetings** to enable continuity of government business during emergencies?
questions.explanation: Chapter 9 of the PSR introduced virtual meetings (PSR 090101) to enable remote work continuity during emergencies [114], [115], [116].

questions.question: The **Treasury Single Account (TSA)** system supports e-Governance by ensuring:
options: Consolidation of government accounts to improve revenue monitoring.
Staff are paid in foreign currency.
questions.explanation: TSA consolidates government accounts, blocking leakages and improving transparency [117], [33], [112].

questions.question: The digitization of the Registry Unit in MDAs is primarily aimed at replacing manual filing with:
questions.explanation: Digitization of the Registry aims to replace manual filing with electronic document management (EDM) [112].

questions.question: The adoption of **Computer-Based Test (CBT)** for promotion exams is intended to:
options: Standardize evaluation and ensure fair assessment across cadres.
questions.explanation: CBT-Based Promotion Exams standardize evaluation across cadres [118].

questions.question: What does **HRMIS** stand for?
options: Harmonized Revenue Management and Information System.
questions.explanation: HRMIS stands for Human Resource Management Information System [119], [109].

questions.question: The use of technology in the public service to deliver services and increase efficiency is collectively known as:
questions.explanation: E-Governance is the use of digital tools to deliver public services and increase efficiency [119].

questions.question: Digital identity integration, linking civil servants to NIN and biometric databases, primarily aims to ensure:
options: Data accuracy and integrity in personnel records.
questions.explanation: Digital Identity Integration links civil servants to biometric databases (NIN) to ensure data accuracy and integrity [120].

questions.question: What is the key benefit of centralizing government payment systems (like TSA and GIFMIS)?
options: Blocking revenue leakages and ensuring unified cash visibility.
Increasing the number of ghost workers.
questions.explanation: Centralized systems like TSA block revenue leakages and ensure unified cash visibility [33].

questions.question: The adoption of **Geo-tagging for Project Monitoring** aids transparency by:
options: Adding GPS data to verify the physical location and status of federal projects.
questions.explanation: Geo-tagging adds GPS data to monitor federal projects, enhancing transparency [118].

questions.question: What is the role of the **National e-Government Masterplan**?
options: To define the national retirement policy.
To guide automation of services, inter-agency data sharing, and secure cloud infrastructure deployment.
To regulate oil and gas pricing.
questions.explanation: The National e-Government Masterplan guides automation of services, data sharing, and secure cloud deployment [87].

questions.question: The **National Information Technology Development Agency (NITDA)** is primarily responsible for:
options: Regulating ICT policy and standards in Nigeria.
questions.explanation: NITDA regulates ICT policy and standards in Nigeria [88].

questions.question: The **IPPIS** system ensures that emoluments are paid to officers based on verified:
questions.explanation: IPPIS uses verified personnel and biometric records to ensure accuracy and prevent fraud [110].

questions.question: In the context of technology adoption, what is the primary benefit of the civil service focusing on **Cloud Migration** for MDAs?
options: Increasing the number of paper files.
Enhancing data security, scalability, and reducing physical infrastructure costs.
questions.explanation: Cloud migration enhances security, scalability, and reduces physical infrastructure costs [112].

questions.question: Which PSR rule introduced emerging work practices like **virtual meetings** in the 2021 edition?
questions.explanation: Rule 090101 introduced virtual meetings to ensure government business continuity [114], [115], [116].

questions.question: The continuous monitoring of digital platforms and systems for suspicious activity is known as:
questions.explanation: Cybersecurity monitoring protects systems from digital threats (Implied ICT competence area) [121].

questions.question: What is the function of the **Audit Trail** in an integrated financial system like GIFMIS?
options: To ensure integrity and traceability of all financial transactions.
questions.explanation: The Audit Trail ensures integrity and traceability of all financial transactions [122], [123].

questions.question: Which technology enhances security and integrity by verifying sender identity and file integrity in official digital correspondence?
questions.explanation: Digital signatures enhance authentication and security by verifying sender identity and file integrity [124].

questions.question: The use of **Biometric E-Attendance Registers** in MDAs primarily aims to reduce:
questions.explanation: E-Attendance Registers via biometric tracking reduce absenteeism and ensure accurate staff presence records [125].

questions.question: The **Nigeria Data Protection Commission (NDPC)** is responsible for enforcing rules related to:
questions.explanation: The NDPC enforces personal data protection regulations (Implied institutional role) [125].

questions.question: In cybersecurity, a **Zero-Day** refers to:
options: A vulnerability that is unknown to the vendor and has no fix yet.
Enabling quick search and retrieval of digital files.
questions.explanation: EDMS enables quick search and retrieval of digital files [112].

questions.question: The **Electronic Document Management System (EDMS)** contributes to efficiency by:
options: Increasing the number of physical files.
Enabling quick search and retrieval of digital files.
questions.explanation: EDMS enables quick search and retrieval of digital files, reducing reliance on slow manual processes.

questions.question: What is the primary function of **HRMIS** in a Ministry?
options: To manage digital staff records, leave, postings, and promotions.
questions.explanation: HRMIS manages digital staff records, leave, postings, and promotions [112].

questions.question: Which PSR Chapter highlights the use of information technology for civil service efficiency?
questions.explanation: Chapter 8 of the CSH encourages the use of IT in modernizing civil service operations [107].

questions.question: The OHCSFs efforts in technology adoption are primarily aimed at driving:
options: HR reforms and capacity building across the service.
questions.explanation: The OHCSF leads HR reforms and capacity building efforts, often utilizing technology platforms like HRMIS [35].

questions.question: What is the primary function of a **Firewall** in a Ministrys network?
options: To filter network traffic and block unauthorized access.
questions.explanation: A firewall filters network traffic and blocks unauthorized access [121].

questions.question: The use of **digital dashboards** in government reporting allows management to quickly visualize:
options: Key performance indicators (KPIs) and data trends.
questions.explanation: Dashboards visually summarize data trends and KPIs for management review [126].

questions.question: Which core principle of the PSR is directly supported by the implementation of the IPPIS and GIFMIS systems?
questions.explanation: Automated, integrated systems fundamentally promote Transparency and Accountability by reducing manual manipulation [33].

questions.question: What term refers to software delivered over the internet, like Office 365 or Gmail?
questions.explanation: SaaS (Software as a Service) describes software delivered over the internet (Implied ICT knowledge).

questions.question: The primary language used to manage and query relational databases (e.g., in HRMIS or GIFMIS) is:
questions.explanation: SQL (Structured Query Language) is used to manage and query databases [96].

questions.question: What is the purpose of the **Procurement Threshold Automation** feature in e-procurement systems?
options: To ensure approval compliance per monetary limits.
questions.explanation: Procurement Threshold Automation ensures approval compliance per monetary limits, preventing circumvention of rules [85].

questions.question: What is the goal of the **Work-from-Anywhere Pilots** introduced in the civil service?
options: To enhance flexibility and continuity of service during emergencies.
To eliminate the need for permanent staff.
To restrict official duties to physical offices.
questions.explanation: Work-from-Anywhere Pilots aim for flexibility and service continuity during emergencies [125].

questions.question: Which PSR Chapter addresses the application of the PSR to Federal Government Parastatals?
questions.explanation: Chapter 17 covers the application of the Public Service Rules to Federal Government Parastatals [104], [105].

questions.question: The core function of a **Router** is to:
options: Direct data packets between different networks.
Filter local traffic on a single LAN.
questions.explanation: A Router directs data packets between networks [96].

questions.question: The **e-Government Masterplan** emphasizes the necessity of inter-agency data sharing to enhance:
questions.explanation: The masterplan supports inter-agency data sharing for better service synergy and policy effectiveness [87].

questions.question: Which common cyberattack involves tricking users into revealing sensitive data like passwords via deceptive emails?
questions.explanation: Phishing is a cyberattack where users are tricked into giving sensitive data [97].

questions.question: Which of the following is considered a key emerging issue added in the 2021 edition of the PSR, enabled by technology?
questions.explanation: Talent sourcing, volunteerism, performance management, and virtual meetings were key emerging issues added in the 2021 edition [83, 98, 99].

questions.question: The process of converting paper records to digital archives is known as:
questions.explanation: Document Scanning and Archiving converts paper records to digital archives [85].

questions.question: In the context of government financial management, **GIFMIS** integrates which of the following functions?
questions.explanation: GIFMIS integrates planning, budgeting, accounting, and reporting across government financial operations [82].

questions.question: The implementation of the **HRMIS** system aims to replace which traditional management tool?
options: Manual registers and paper-based staff records.
questions.explanation: HRMIS is designed to replace manual, paper-based staff record keeping, minimizing errors and loss of documents [82].

questions.question: The **National e-Government Masterplan** emphasizes the deployment of secure **cloud infrastructure** to:
options: Provide scalable and reliable computing resources for MDAs.
questions.explanation: Cloud infrastructure deployment provides scalable and reliable computing resources [87].

questions.question: What is the primary function of a **VPN** (Virtual Private Network) in secure remote access for civil servants?
options: Securely encrypting data and providing private access over public networks.
questions.explanation: VPNs encrypt data and provide private access over public networks, ensuring secure remote access [100].

questions.question: The **National Identity Number (NIN)** is integrated into public service systems (like IPPIS) primarily to ensure:
options: Unique identification and data integrity of citizens and staff.
The officer is exempt from the PSR.
questions.explanation: NIN integration ensures unique identification and data integrity [89].

questions.question: The core component that automates the tracking of budget allocations, expenditures, and balances per subhead (FR 601) is represented digitally in the **GIFMIS** system by the:
questions.explanation: The Vote Book (FR 601) is the core financial control register [101]. GIFMIS digitizes this function.

questions.question: Which document is considered the framework to digitize service delivery and inter-agency communication?
questions.explanation: The National e-Government Masterplan serves as the framework for digitization and service automation [87].

questions.question: The **OHCSF IT Department Restructuring** focuses on enhancing the capacity for:
options: Reform coordination and IT architecture across the civil service.
questions.explanation: Restructuring aims to enhance reform coordination and IT architecture management across the service [85].

questions.question: The primary objective of **Training on Cyber Hygiene** for civil servants is to build awareness against threats like:
questions.explanation: Training on Cyber Hygiene builds awareness against phishing and malware [92].

subcategories.name: Service Delivery and Grievance
subcategories.description: Service delivery principles, grievance handling, and public service excellence

questions.question: Which chapter of the Civil Service Handbook emphasizes **service delivery** as the core of civil service responsibilities?
questions.explanation: Chapter 4 emphasizes service delivery as the key role of civil servants in meeting citizens' needs [102].

questions.question: The public service initiative focused on enhancing service quality, timeliness, and customer satisfaction is known as:
questions.explanation: Servicom (Service Compact with All Nigerians) pledges public service efficiency and citizen-centered delivery [103].

questions.question: Which section of the Civil Service Handbook outlines grievance procedures to resolve disputes within the civil service?
questions.explanation: Chapter 7 provides grievance procedures to resolve disputes within the civil service [104].

questions.question: An aggrieved officer who wishes to appeal a disciplinary decision must generally submit their appeal within how many days of the decision being communicated?
questions.explanation: Appeals must generally be submitted within 30 days of the decision being communicated.

questions.question: Appeals against promotion bypass should be heard within:
questions.explanation: Promotion bypass appeals should be heard within 30 days [105].

questions.question: The principle of **Impartiality** in service delivery guarantees:
options: Service is provided only to government officials.
Fair and unbiased service to all citizens.
questions.explanation: Impartiality guarantees that civil servants serve all citizens fairly without political or personal bias [106, 107].

questions.question: The **Freedom of Information (FOI) Act** supports public service transparency by ensuring:
options: All staff must declare assets annually.
The public has the right to access government-held information.
Contracts are awarded through direct procurement only.
questions.explanation: The FOI Act grants the public the right to request and access public records [80, 97].

questions.question: Which body typically handles petitions regarding allowances or entitlements (PSR practice)?
options: The Office of the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF).
questions.explanation: The OHCSF handles petitions concerning allowances and similar entitlements [3].

questions.question: Which principle in the Handbook mandates that decisions and processes are open, with records available for accountability?
questions.explanation: Transparency requires that decisions and processes are open, with records available for accountability.

questions.question: An officer may seek redress for grievance regarding posting instructions (Rule 020606) if they believe the decision violates:
questions.explanation: Officers may seek redress where they believe movement was not done in line with the provisions of extant rules [59, 60].

questions.question: According to the Civil Service Handbook, respecting **diversity** in the workplace is important to:
questions.explanation: Respecting diversity fosters inclusivity, unity, and fairness in the workplace [106].

questions.question: The principle of **Efficiency** in service delivery requires that government services:
options: Meet public needs effectively and deliver value for money.
Are provided only to the highest bidder.
questions.explanation: Efficiency ensures civil servants meet public needs effectively and deliver value for money.

questions.question: The PSR permits **only one petition for review** per disciplinary matter (Rule 120230). This is intended to prevent:
options: The issuance of a written query.
questions.explanation: Only one petition for review is allowed per matter to prevent frivolous and unending appeals [105].

questions.question: The ethical requirement for accountability in the use of government resources is emphasized in which chapter of the Handbook?
questions.explanation: Chapter 4 emphasizes accountability in the utilization of government funds and resources [108].

questions.question: If an appeal against a disciplinary decision is pending in a Court of Law, the administrative appeal/petition will:
options: Be suspended until the court case is decided.
questions.explanation: An appeal/petition will not be entertained if it deals with a case in which legal action is pending in a Court of Law (Rule 110208(ii)) [63, 64].

questions.question: The final conclusion of an appeal/petition (Rule 110210) must state concisely:
options: The nature of the redress sought and a summary of the reasons adduced in support of the redress sought.
The full names of all FCSC members.
questions.explanation: The conclusion of an appeal/petition shall state concisely the nature of the redress sought and a summary of the reasons adduced in support of the redress sought [63, 64].

questions.question: What is the primary objective of the FCSC overseeing disciplinary procedures (Rule 100305)?
options: To ensure the officer is dismissed quickly.
To ensure the process upholds due process and natural justice.
To transfer all officers to other MDAs.
To negotiate a high pension payout.
questions.explanation: The FCSCs oversight ensures that the disciplinary process adheres to due process and principles of natural justice [109, 110].

questions.question: The principle of **Anonymity** supports service delivery by directing public attention and accountability towards:
options: The senior civil servant providing the advice.
questions.explanation: Anonymity ensures that civil servants do not seek recognition, directing praise or blame for policy outcomes toward the political executive.

questions.question: The PSR encourages civil servants to maintain high ethical standards, which directly correlates with the delivery of:
questions.explanation: High ethical standards promote impartial and incorruptible service, enhancing public trust.

questions.question: Petitions regarding disciplinary matters must be submitted through the proper channel within:
questions.explanation: Appeals must generally be submitted within 30 days of the decision being communicated, following the time limits for appeals.

questions.question: Which body serves as an advocate for the strict compliance with due process and operational rules in the service?
options: The National Council on Public Procurement.
questions.explanation: The FCSC serves as an advocate for the strict compliance with due process and operational rules in the service, and promotes the professionalization of the Service [111, 112].

questions.question: The principle of **Meritocracy** in the civil service is a key component of service delivery excellence because it ensures:
options: Appointments are based on seniority alone.
The most competent and qualified individuals are responsible for public service delivery.
questions.explanation: Meritocracy ensures that appointments and promotions are based on competence, leading to higher quality service delivery [53, 113].

questions.question: The PSR guarantees that a petition will **NOT** be entertained if it is worded in:
questions.explanation: An appeal/petition will not be entertained if it is worded in abusive, improper, or foul language [63, 64].

questions.question: The **Rewards and Recognition System (R&RS)** is a service delivery tool designed to:
options: Incentivize high performance and professional excellence.
questions.explanation: R&RS incentivizes high performance and professional excellence, driving improved service delivery.

questions.question: PSR Rule 020606 allows officers to seek redress for grievances regarding posting instructions. This is handled through:
questions.explanation: Complaints/grievances must be submitted through the appropriate channel [59, 60].

questions.question: Which principle guarantees that citizens receive fair and equitable service, regardless of their ethnic, religious, or political background?
questions.explanation: Neutrality/Impartiality ensures service is fair and equitable to all citizens.

questions.question: The PSR mandates that all officers must be familiar with and comply strictly with the PSR. This rule aims to ensure:
options: Ignorance is an excuse for failure.
Uniformity and compliance in administrative and disciplinary processes.
Only senior officers understand the rules.
questions.explanation: Officers must familiarize themselves and comply strictly with the PSR; ignorance is not an excuse [114].

questions.question: Which PSR Chapter allows an aggrieved officer to petition decisions through the proper channels?
questions.explanation: Chapter 11 covers Petitions and Appeals, allowing aggrieved officers to seek redress [44, 63, 64].

questions.question: The principle of **Accountability** in service delivery is demonstrated when civil servants are required to:
options: Be answerable for their actions and decisions.
questions.explanation: Accountability ensures civil servants are answerable for their official actions and decisions.

questions.question: The **Federal Character Principle** (Section 14(3) of the Constitution) supports service delivery excellence by ensuring:
options: Equitable representation and diversity, enhancing national cohesion in public service.
The civil service is governed by foreign nationals.
questions.explanation: The Federal Character Principle ensures equitable representation of states and ethnic groups in appointments [115].

questions.question: Which body must an officer appeal to if they are dissatisfied with a promotion exercise (PSR practice)?
options: The Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF) for allowances/petitions (Rule 110102) or the FCSC (Rule 020805) for promotion decisions.
questions.explanation: Officers dissatisfied with promotion exercises have a right of appeal to the FCSC (Rule 020805) [27, 28].

questions.question: What is the consequence if an appeal/petition is illegible or meaningless (Rule 110208(iii))?
options: It is automatically transferred to court.
The officer is given a warning.
questions.explanation: An appeal/petition will not be entertained if it is illegible or meaningless [63, 64].

questions.question: The principle of **Efficiency** in service delivery relies heavily on the proper implementation of:
options: Staff recruitment based on regional bias.
questions.explanation: Efficiency relies on robust performance management and continuous training to ensure staff competence [82, 116].

questions.question: The **Civil Service Values** that underpin service delivery include Integrity, Neutrality, Service, Discipline, and:
questions.explanation: Core values include integrity, neutrality, service, discipline, and accountability [74, 117].

questions.question: The PSR ensures service continuity by applying the rules of the service to Federal Government **Parastatals** where:
options: The Parastatal has no internal rules or where internal rules have gaps/inconsistencies.
The Parastatal is fully funded by the federal government.
The Parastatal is a research agency.
questions.explanation: PSR applies where internal rules and procedures in Parastatals are nonexistent or inconsistent with general PSR principles (Rule 170104) [75, 76].

questions.question: The establishment of appropriate staff committees (JSC, SSC) in Federal Government Parastatals is mandated to handle all matters of:
options: Appointments, promotion, and discipline of officers.
questions.explanation: Staff committees in Parastatals handle appointments, promotion, and discipline of officers [66, 67].

questions.question: Which PSR rule covers the prohibition on seeking influence of prominent persons to gain appointment, transfer, promotion, or postings?
questions.explanation: Rule 100427 prohibits seeking influence of prominent persons for career advantages [72, 73].

questions.question: PSR Rule 020606 states that officers may seek redress for grievance regarding posting instructions, provided they submit the complaint within:
options: Three working days of the posting instruction being released.
questions.explanation: Complaints/grievances must be submitted through appropriate channel within three working days [59, 60].

questions.question: The PSR requires that an officer on promotion who is dissatisfied with the outcome must exercise their right of appeal through:
options: The appropriate channel and in accordance with Chapter 11.
questions.explanation: Appeals must be exercised through the appropriate channel in accordance with Chapter 11 (Petitions and Appeals) [27, 28, 44].

questions.question: The principle of **Teamwork** in the Civil Service Handbook is emphasized to:
options: Enhance collective efficiency and service delivery.
questions.explanation: Teamwork enhances collective efficiency and service delivery [104].

questions.question: Which PSR rule ensures that officers who resigned are liable to refund the full cost of any training given, if governed by the bond?
questions.explanation: An Officer who resigns will be liable to refund to the Government the full sum of money which he may be owing to Government or which, under the provisions of other rules or agreements, is refundable to Government (Rule 020904(a)(ii)) [50, 51].

questions.question: The mandatory requirement for **record-keeping** (CSH) primarily ensures:
options: Accountability, transparency, and continuity in civil service operations.
Transfer of responsibility to junior officers.
questions.explanation: Proper record-keeping ensures accountability, transparency, and continuity in civil service operations [118].

questions.question: What is the primary objective of the **Sabbatical Appointment** (Rule 020413) for senior officers?
options: The purpose of research and professional development of the Officer.
questions.explanation: Sabbatical Appointment is for the purpose of research and professional development of the Officer [42, 43].

questions.question: The PSR provides that an officer may be granted **Leave of Absence** on grounds of public policy. The leave shall be approved by:
options: The Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF).
questions.explanation: Leave of Absence on grounds of public policy shall be approved by the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation (OHCSF) [37, 38].

questions.question: Which PSR rule covers the conditions for officers who leave the service other than by resignation or dismissal being eligible for proportionate leave?
questions.explanation: Rule 020905 covers eligibility for proportionate leave for officers leaving the Service other than by resignation or dismissal [50, 51].

questions.question: The PSR requires that appeals against promotion decisions must be considered with reference to the guidelines set out by the:
questions.explanation: The consideration governing all promotions shall be in accordance with the guidelines set out by the Federal Civil Service Commission [27, 28].

questions.question: Which PSR Chapter applies to officers going on religious pilgrimages?
questions.explanation: Chapter 12 covers Leave, Absence & Holidays, including leave for religious purposes (Rule 120232) [37, 38].

questions.question: The Civil Service Handbook emphasizes that a civil servant's ultimate duty is to ensure:
options: Service delivery is impartial and effective.
questions.explanation: The ultimate duty of civil servants is to provide impartial and effective service.

questions.question: PSR Rule 120233 allows for special leave with full pay for a period up to two weeks on **compassionate grounds** for:
options: Burying a spouse, child, parent/parent of spouse.
questions.explanation: Compassionate leave (full pay) is granted for up to two weeks for the burial of spouse/child/parent/parent of spouse [37, 38].

questions.question: The FCSC facilitates improvement in the welfare of employees and enriching the Administrative Procedures/Guidelines in the Public Service, serving as:
questions.explanation: The FCSC promotes the professionalization of the Service and facilitates welfare improvement [111, 112].
